marketNews.title: Consumer Price Index Inflation in the US Slows for 5 Consecutive Months to 2.5% YoY in August 2024
marketNews.content: Consumer price index inflation in the US was recorded to slow for 5 consecutive months reaching the level of 2.5% YoY in August 2024 (vs. July 2024: 2.9% YoY inflation), lower than the consensus expectation of 2.6% YoY and marking the lowest level since February 2021. On a monthly basis, inflation reached 0.2% MoM (vs. July 2024: 0.2% MoM inflation), in line with consensus expectations. Meanwhile, core inflation stabilized at the lowest level in the last 3 years at 3.2% YoY, but on a monthly basis slightly increased to 0.3% MoM (vs. July 2024: 0.2% inflation) and exceeded the consensus expectation of 0.2% MoM.

marketNews.title: China's Customs Records Crude Oil Imports of 11.56 Million Barrels Per Day in August 2024
marketNews.content: China's customs noted that the country imported crude oil amounting to 11.56 million barrels per day in August 2024, soaring +15.9% MoM. Reuters reported that this increase was likely caused by lower global oil prices. China's crude oil imports in August 2024 were still down -7% YoY, with realizations over 8M24 plunging -3.1% YoY.

marketNews.title: Vice Minister of Finance Thomas Djiwandono Denies Rumors About Sri Mulyani Being Offered Finance Minister Position by President-Elect
marketNews.content: Vice Minister of Finance, Thomas Djiwandono, denied rumors that Sri Mulyani was offered the position of Finance Minister by president-elect, Prabowo Subianto. Katadata reported that the issue emerged after Sri Mulyani, Thomas, and Prabowo held a meeting on Monday (9/9).

marketNews.title: Head of OJK's Capital Market Supervision States the Regulator is Finalizing Rules on IPO Fund Realization
marketNews.content: Head of Capital Market, Derivatives, and Carbon Exchange Supervisory Authority of OJK, Inarno Djajadi, stated that the authority is refining OJK Regulation 30/POJK.04/2015 concerning the Report on the Realization of Proceeds Utilization from Public Offerings in order to tighten the use of IPO funds. Refinements to this regulation will include promoting more detailed information disclosure on the realization report of IPO fund utilization, including fund usage at the subsidiary level. Furthermore, the regulation will also govern the alignment between the details of fund usage in the prospectus and its realization. This step to refine the regulation was taken by OJK after there were still issuers who had not fully utilized the proceeds from the public offering.

marketNews.title: PP Health Regulation Causes 7% of Out-of-Home Advertising Companies to Go Bankrupt
marketNews.content: Chairman of the Indonesian Out-of-Home Media Association, Fabianus Bernadi, stated that Government Regulation No. 28 of 2024 concerning Health, which prohibits the display of tobacco product advertisements within 500 meters of educational units and children's playgrounds, had caused 7% of out-of-home (OOH) advertising companies in Indonesia to go bankrupt. Fabianus mentioned that cigarette advertisements contributed 50% of revenue from 30% of OOH advertising companies in Indonesia. Based on the association's estimation, the implementation of this regulation has the potential to trigger layoffs for approximately 60% of workers in the OOH advertising industry.

tickerNews.title: ADRO Plans Spin-Off of Thermal Coal Business
tickerNews.content: Adaro Energy Indonesia (ADRO) plans to spin-off and sell its entire thermal coal business segment under PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia (AAI). The sale of AAI shares will be conducted through an initial public offering (IPO) mechanism to interested shareholders of the company. ADRO is also considering distributing a cash dividend to all shareholders, which can later be used to help fund interested shareholders in participating in the AAI IPO. The offering price for the AAI IPO will use the volume weighted average price (VWAP) formed after the close of trading on the listing date on the exchange, while still observing transaction fairness as regulated in POJK number 35 of 2020. Based on the assessment from a public accounting firm, the fair value of AAI ranges from 2.45-2.6 billion US dollars. This plan will be discussed in the EGM on October 18, 2024. AAI is a subsidiary of ADRO with an ownership of 99.99% and is engaged in the thermal coal business line and coal mining support facilities. Some of AAI's business lines include logistics services, land, water, investment, and electricity businesses. In 1H24, AAI had total assets of 5.4 billion US dollars, equivalent to 52.9% of ADRO's total assets. In the same period, AAI's revenue and net profit were recorded at 2.6 billion US dollars and 992.8 million US dollars, equivalent to 89.4% of ADRO's revenue and 104.8% of ADRO's net profit, respectively. AAI's net profit includes a one-off income of 322.9 million US dollars which is eliminated in ADRO's net profit. Key Takeaway After this transaction, ADRO will focus on the metallurgical coal segment under Adaro Minerals (ADMR) and the renewable energy segment under Adaro Green. The funds obtained by ADRO after the AAI spin-off can be used by the company to fund expansion - both organic and inorganic - or to distribute dividends to its shareholders. Referring to the fair price of AAI and its financial statements as of 1H24, and excluding the one-off profit of 322.9 million US dollars, AAI has the potential to be traded with a valuation of 1.8-2x P/E FY24F annualized. This valuation is far below its peers, namely ITMG and PTBA, which are traded at P/E FY24F annualized valuations of 7.04 and 7.71, respectively. This transaction also potentially benefits Saratoga Investama Sedaya (SRTG) as a holder of ~15% of ADRO shares. SRTG may receive a special dividend from the AAI spin-off plan. Furthermore, SRTG will also have the option to participate in the AAI share offering.

tickerNews.title: ANZ Group Rumored to Divest PNBN Stake
tickerNews.content: PNBN: Bloomberg reported that Bank Pan Indonesia shareholder, ANZ Group Holdings Ltd., is reconsidering selling its entire 38.8% stake in PNBN to reduce its position in several long-held Asian assets. Bloomberg sources mentioned that ANZ has engaged financial advisors to divest this stake, with potential buyers including banks from Japan and Malaysia. Previously, ANZ had planned to sell PNBN in 2015, but negotiations were hampered because PNBN's controlling shareholder was reluctant to grant a board seat to a new investor. Bloomberg also reported that Mitsubishi UFJ Financial Group Inc. and Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group Inc. had previously considered buying PNBN, but later withdrew due to valuation issues.

tickerNews.title: Astra International's Domestic Car Wholesale Sales Decline in August 2024
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International recorded domestic car wholesale sales of 42,195 units (-3.6% MoM, -17% YoY) in August 2024. This result was lower than the growth in non-ASII car sales which reached +12% MoM and -10.5% YoY. Consequently, ASII's market share fell to 55.3% in August 2024 (vs. July 2024: 59%, August 2023: 57.1%). The weakening of ASII's sales was pressured by a decline in Daihatsu sales to 13,829 units (-0.6% MoM, -20.9% YoY) as well as Toyota and Lexus sales to 26,183 units (-4.1% MoM, -13.8% YoY). Over 8M24, ASII's car wholesale sales fell -15.8% YoY with a market share of 56.7% (vs. 8M23: 55.8%).

tickerNews.title: Medco Energi Internasional to Distribute 2024 Interim Dividend of IDR 15.75 Per Share
tickerNews.content: MEDC: Medco Energi Internasional President Director, Hilmi Panigoro, stated that the company will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 15.75 rupiah per share. Nevertheless, Hilmi did not specify when this interim dividend would be distributed.

tickerNews.title: Sonny Satia Negara Sells 368,000 SSIA Shares Reducing Stake to 0.070%
tickerNews.content: SSIA: Surya Semesta Internusa Director, Sonny Satia Negara, sold 368,000 SSIA shares at an average price of 1,358.2 rupiah per share on September 6-9, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 500 million rupiah. After this transaction, Sonny Satia Negara's ownership in SSIA decreased from 0.078% to 0.070%.

tickerNews.title: Bambang Prijonohadi Sells 60,000 KKGI Shares
tickerNews.content: KKGI: Resource Alam Indonesia Director, Bambang Prijonohadi, sold 60,000 KKGI shares at an average price of 596.63 rupiah per share on September 10, 2024. The total transaction value reached 35.8 million rupiah. After this transaction, Bambang Prijonohadi's ownership in KKGI decreased from 0.002% to 0.001%.

tickerNews.title: PT Anugerah Inti Karisma Sells 3.2 Million PEGE Shares, Stake Decreases to 16.34%
tickerNews.content: PEGE: Panca Global Kapital shareholder, PT Anugerah Inti Karisma, sold 3.2 million PEGE shares, based on KSEI data as of September 10, 2024. The transaction value is not yet known. After this transaction, PT Anugerah Inti Karisma's ownership in PEGE decreased from 16.45% to 16.34%.

tickerNews.title: PT Hexa Prima Nusantara Plans to Acquire Controlling Stake in FUTR, to Launch Mandatory Tender Offer
tickerNews.content: FUTR: Lini Imaji Kreasi Ekosistem announced that PT Hexa Prima Nusantara plans to acquire a majority controlling stake in FUTR, PT Digital Futurama Global. After the completion of this transaction, PT Hexa Prima Nusantara will become the new controller of FUTR and will proceed with a mandatory tender offer.

tickerNews.title: Johan Tedja Surya Buys ~5.6 Million AMAN Shares, Increasing Stake to 1.06%
tickerNews.content: AMAN: Controller and President Commissioner of Makmur Berkah Amanda, Johan Tedja Surya, purchased approximately 5.6 million AMAN shares at an average price of 112 rupiah per share on September 10, 2024. The total transaction value reached approximately 624 million rupiah. After this transaction, Johan Tedja Surya's ownership in AMAN increased from 0.92% to 1.06%.
